abstract.p: Crystal Cruises renovates spa aboard Crystal Symphony to conform with feng shui, ancient Oriental practice of managing interior space to create balance and harmony; Crystal Harmony's spa will be similarly revamped (S)

block.p: The principles of feng shui, the Asian practice of placing buildings and arranging interior spaces to create balance and harmony, are becoming as commonplace as dim sum. Crystal Cruises has renovated the spa aboard its Crystal Symphony to conform with feng shui tenets, and the Crystal Harmony's spa will get the same treatment later this year. Among the touches on the Symphony that are designed to allow qi (life force) to flow like the tides are Chinese tiles outside beauty rooms and Zen rock gardens in waiting rooms. Call (800) 820-6663.

Explorations in Travel offers wilderness trips for women over 40 in U.S. national parks and abroad. Among the scheduled journeys is a rafting trip on the Salmon River in Idaho from Sept. 9 to 16 for $2,295 a person, including air fare to the river from Boise. The company also offers multigenerational trips for mothers and daughters (and granddaughters). Contact Explorations in Travel, 1922 River Road, Guilford, Vt. 05301; (802) 257-0152, fax (802) 257-2784.
HOTEL A Room and a Chef

Putting a new twist on room service, the Edgewater Hotel in Seattle allows guests to order up a chef from its restaurant. Its Buy the Chef program lets guests hire a personal chef to customize a three-course dinner, on Friday or Saturday, subject to availability. Prices for the meal start at $45 a person, not including tax, tip and beverages. It can be served in the room or in the hotel's restaurant. Doubles start at $225. The 268-room Edgewater is at 2411 Alaskan Way, on the water at Pier 67. Call (206) 728-7000.
